result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Methamphetamine Precursors [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit of 55 days if revoked.  Does not include credit for any good time which may apply

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample
AODA and follow through
No use or possession of controlled substances except as prescribed and ingested as prescribed
No contact with R.X.  Probation officer may lift if/when feels appropriate

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles J. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed after case disposed of, addressed at hearing

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Charles J. Smith in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:39 a.m. Court has been advised that waiver of prelim was not done and information was not filed. Court explains to Def three options to correct procedural error. Def would like to fix error and let sentencing remain. Court explains preliminary hearing rights. Def waives prelim. Court accepts waiver as knowing and voluntary. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived. Court reviews sentence from 12/1/16 on cts 2 and 4. Def has no questions. Nothing further from Counsel.

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Charles J. Smith in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF113, 15CM32, 16CF48 and 16CF163 @ 3:28 p.m. Agreement stated - 16CF163 Def will plead to ct 1 and ct 2. Ct 1 - 60 days jail, $1760 total fine and costs, 14 month revocation. Ct 2 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA, no possession or use of controlled substances except as prescribed, 60 days jail, court costs. Jail consecutive to OWI. 16CF48 - Def will plead to cts 2 and 4. Ct 2 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, same conditions as ct 2 of 16CF163 except no additional jail. Ct 4 - 30 days jail, court costs. Dismiss and read in all remaining cts in 16CF48, 16CF163 and all cts in 15CF113 and 15CM32. Atty Abernethy-Mays and Def agree. Request to speak is made by person in attendance. Statement by ADA Laufenberg. Discussion regarding allowing comments by T.N.  Plea quest. reviewed. 16CF163 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 2 - no contest plea. 16CF48 ct 2 - no contest plea. Ct 4 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 16CF48 cts 1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 & 10 and 16CF163 cts 3, 4, 5, & 6. 15CF113 ct 1 dismissed, cts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in. 15CF32 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Abernethy-Mays satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 16CF163 ct 1 OWI 2nd and ct 2 felony bail jumping as repeater. Court finds guilty of 16CF48 ct 2 and ct 4. Sentencing remarks by State. State will not make recommendation on whether Court should hear from T.N. Atty Abernethy-Mays makes statement. Court will allow. T.N. makes statement. Sentencing remarks by Atty Abernethy-Mays. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Court orders 16CF163 ct 1 - 60 days jail, $1710 total fine and costs, 14 month revocation, alcohol assessment and driver safety plan, Credit for 127 days served, sentence complete. Ct 2 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, no use or possession of controlled substances except as prescribed and ingested as prescribed. No contact w/R.X. Probation officer may lift if/when feels appropriate. 60 days jail, consecutive to ct 1. No credit for time served. Commence today. Court costs. DNA sample and surcharge. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Huber. 16CF48 ct 2 - 6 yrs prison, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv, imposed and stayed. 2 yrs probation. Def eligible for earned release and challenge inc. Conditions of probation same as ct 2 of 16CF163 (clarified - except no conditional jail time). Court costs, DNA surcharge. Ct 4 - 30 days jail consecutive to all other, sentence complete, court costs, DNA surcharge. Total sentence credit is 145 days, applied to OWI and ct 4 of 16CF48. 77 days credit if revoked on 16CF163 ct 2 or 16CF48 ct 2 - credit may only be given once. Bond in 16CF48 apply to costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Statement by Def regarding no contact. Bond to be applied first to ct 4 of 16CF48 and then 16CF163 ct 1. pmt plan for balance, beginning first full month - 2/17.  (Jail time credit verified with Judge)

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Charles J. Smith in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  called at 5:07pm  Cases called 16TR890, 16CF163, 16CF48. 15CF113 and 15CM32.  16CF163 def will waive right to preliminary hearing.  Bond forfeiture hearing will follow cases.  16CF48 does not have information filed, time limits have been waived.  16CF163 def requested timely preliminary.  Statement by Atty Abernethy-Mays.  Speedy trial requested for 16CF163.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed for 16CF163.  Court reviews form with def.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court accepts waiver for 16CF163.  Court finds probable cause, bound over.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Reserve jurisdicational objections.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accpt not guilty pleas.  Counsel will be filing speedy trial demand.  All cases will be set for status conf.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court via video, in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:57 p.m. Def has copy of complaint. Charges and possible penalties reviewed. Def advised to contact public defender's office. State heard on bond. State moves to forfeit bond in 16CF48 and requests new $5000 cash bond to cover both files. Court forfeits bond in 16CF48 subject to hearing. Court sets bond to cover both.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:16 am. Atty Abernethy-Mays request bail bond modification. Def. makes statement.  Court reviews conditions.  No contact with R.X. be removed.  State heard on residing with father.  Court explains concerns. Court will modify bond no longer need to reside with father and no contact with R.X. also can be removed. Only condition is: No possession of ephedrine  or pseudoephedrine.
Reside with Father at W6955 Hwy 64, Bryant, WI   No contact with R. X.  No possession of ephedrine  or pseudoephedrine

Defendant Charles J. Smith in court via video, with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays by phone.  Defendant Charles J. Smith in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, waive reading.  Penalties reviewed.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Court explains right to timely preliminary.  Def agrees to waive time limits.  Atty Abernethy-Mays presents arguments for bond.  15CF113 State moves to forfeit this cash bond.  Arguments for bond by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court reviews previous files.  Bond in 15CF113 was converted to signature bond.  Court will reduce bond  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
